items.title: Alibaba reaffirms open-source AI commitment as tech giant hails Qwen achievements
items.creator: Vincent Chow
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Alibaba reaffirms open-source AI commitment as tech giant hails Qwen achievements
items.content:
Alibaba Group Holding’s artificial intelligence strategy is defined by a commitment to open-source models, the company said on Tuesday, following a year of soaring adoption for its suite of AI services.
The statement came as Alibaba’s stock in New York rose more than 10 per cent on Monday, following news that its flagship Qwen family of AI models surpassed 700 million downloads on the developer platform Hugging Face, making it the world’s most widely adopted open-source AI system.
“A defining...

items.title: DeepSeek founder’s latest paper proposes new AI model training to bypass GPU limits
items.creator: Vincent Chow
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: DeepSeek founder’s latest paper proposes new AI model training to bypass GPU limits

images.alt: The DeepSeek app is seen on a smartphone with its founder Liang Wenfeng in the background in this arranged picture taken on May 23, 2025. Photo: Shutterstock Images
images.title: The DeepSeek app is seen on a smartphone with its founder Liang Wenfeng in the background in this arranged picture taken on May 23, 2025. Photo: Shutterstock Images

items.content:
A technical paper co-authored by Liang Wenfeng, the founder of Chinese artificial intelligence start-up DeepSeek, and a group of Peking University researchers has proposed a new model training technique, which they say can facilitate “aggressive parameter expansion” by bypassing graphics processing unit (GPU) memory constraints.
The development underscores the Hangzhou start-up’s continued focus on maximising cost efficiency amid a deficit in computational power relative to US industry leaders,...

items.title: UBS conveys upbeat note on Chinese stocks in 2026 as global investors seek diversification
items.creator: Zhang Shidong,Daniel Ren
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: UBS conveys upbeat note on Chinese stocks in 2026 as global investors seek diversification
items.content:
UBS Group conveyed a sanguine outlook on Chinese stocks in 2026, as the world’s second-largest economy proved to be an important alternative for global investors seeking to diversify away from US equities, which face headwinds from stretched valuations to jitters about the independence of the Federal Reserve.
Chinese stocks are expected to be energised by the nation’s growing innovation capability, greater adoption of artificial intelligence across traditional industries and potential inflows...

items.title: Apple, Google strike Gemini deal for revamped Siri in major win for Alphabet
items.creator: Reuters
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Apple, Google strike Gemini deal for revamped Siri in major win for Alphabet

images.alt: This combination of pictures created on January 12, 2026 shows the Apple and Google logos. Photo: AFP
images.title: This combination of pictures created on January 12, 2026 shows the Apple and Google logos. Photo: AFP

items.content:
Apple will use Google’s Gemini models for its revamped ‍Siri coming later this year under a multi-year deal that deepens the tech giants’ alliance in the artificial intelligence era and bolsters Alphabet’s position in the race against OpenAI.
The deal announced Monday marks a major vote of confidence for Google. Its technology already drives much of Samsung’s “Galaxy AI”, but the Siri deal ⁠unlocks a large market with Apple’s installed base of more than two billion active devices.
“After careful...

items.title: Hong Kong stocks climb as yuan hits strongest level in nearly 3 years (原标题: Hong Kong stocks climb as yuan strengthens and investors broaden focus beyond US)
items.creator: Cao Li
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Hong Kong stocks climb as yuan hits strongest level in nearly 3 years
items.content:
Hong Kong stocks rose on Tuesday as global investors broadened their focus beyond US markets, fuelling gains across Asian equities, while the yuan advanced to its strongest level against the US dollar since May 2023.
The Hang Seng Index closed 0.9 per cent up at 26,848.47 after earlier gaining more than 2 per cent to 27,143 – its highest since last November. The Hang Seng Tech Index was little changed after advancing more than 2.4 per cent in the morning.
On the mainland, the CSI 300 Index and...

items.title: Chip designer GigaDevice surges 45% in Hong Kong debut amid China’s self-reliance drive (原标题: Chip designer GigaDevice jumps 37% in Hong Kong debut amid China’s self-reliance drive)
items.creator: Themis Qi,Aileen Chuang
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Chip designer GigaDevice surges 45% in Hong Kong debut amid China’s self-reliance drive

images.alt: GigaDevice’s trading debut on the Hong Kong stock exchange on January 13, 2026.
images.title: GigaDevice’s trading debut on the Hong Kong stock exchange on January 13, 2026.

items.content:
Mainland chip designer GigaDevice Semiconductor jumped more than 37 per cent on its first trading day in Hong Kong on Tuesday, as the Beijing-based firm’s debut catered to investor appetite for tech companies amid China’s push for self-reliance.
The firm’s shares surged 45 per cent to HK$235 at the start of trading, versus the offer price of HK$162, before ending the day up 37.5 per cent at HK$222.80. The close valued the company at around HK$155.2 billion (US$19.9 billion). Its Shanghai-listed...

items.title: China’s weight-loss drug war: prices slashed up to 80% as obesity crisis worsens
items.creator: Julie Zhang
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: China’s weight-loss drug war: prices slashed up to 80% as obesity crisis worsens
items.content:
Foreign and mainland Chinese drug makers are fighting for a multibillion-dollar slice of the domestic weight-loss market by slashing prices by as much as 80 per cent, as China faces a worsening obesity crisis.
Competition in the sector, dominated by global pharmaceutical giants Novo Nordisk and Eli Lilly, intensified after both secured obesity-drug approvals in China in 2024. The landscape is set to shift further when the patent on Novo Nordisk’s semaglutide expires in March in China, opening...

items.translated_title: Biotech disruptor pushes cancer-targeting cell and gene therapies beyond boundaries

images.alt: In CAR T cell therapy, a patient’s immune cells are genetically engineered and navigated to recognise and destroy malignant cells.
images.title: In CAR T cell therapy, a patient’s immune cells are genetically engineered and navigated to recognise and destroy malignant cells.

images.alt: SPH Cell’s proprietary best-in-class method can generate large numbers of T cells preserved frozen in liquid nitrogen. The preserved cells can be thawed and remain energetic and ready.
images.title: SPH Cell’s proprietary best-in-class method can generate large numbers of T cells preserved frozen in liquid nitrogen. The preserved cells can be thawed and remain energetic and ready.

images.alt: SPH Cell operates on a unique model of “R&D in Hong Kong, clinical translation in Shanghai,” Zhang says.
images.title: SPH Cell operates on a unique model of “R&D in Hong Kong, clinical translation in Shanghai,” Zhang says.

items.content:
[The content of this article has been produced by our advertising partner.]
 
Cancer is not only a health emergency, but also an economic scourge. In the coming decades, its impact is projected to strip trillions from the global economy. The disease does not discriminate: a diagnosis can force both top executives and everyday employees to put their careers on hold. For many families, it means suffered emotional turmoil, drained savings, disrupted plans, and futures rewritten. Multiply this...

items.translated_title: DeepSeek founder’s High-Flyer ranks among China’s top hedge-fund firms in 2025
items.content:
High-Flyer Quant, co-owned by DeepSeek founder and CEO Liang Wenfeng, recorded a return of 56.6 per cent last year to rank second among China’s 10 top-performing large hedge-fund firms.
According to the ranking published on Monday by data provider Shenzhen PaiPaiWang Investment & Management, High-Flyer only trailed behind Lingjun Investment, which posted a return of 73.5 per cent in 2025.
All the top performers were quantitative hedge funds, underscoring the popularity in China of using complex...

items.title: China vows more support for ‘little giant’-like firms amid self-sufficiency push

items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: China vows more support for ‘little giant’-like firms amid self-sufficiency push
items.content:
China’s industry regulator has pledged to provide more fiscal support for small-scale innovative firms in specialised industries – such as the country’s “little giants” – as part of a basket of measures designed to boost the country’s technological self-reliance and upgrade key industries.
Li Lecheng, the head of China’s Ministry of Industry and Information Technology, told Xinhua that central authorities would implement a fresh round of fiscal support policies for small and medium-sized firms...

items.translated_title: UK regulator launches probe into Musk’s X over Grok’s ‘disgusting’ sexualised AI imagery
items.content:
Britain’s media regulator launched an investigation into Elon Musk’s ‌X on Monday to determine whether sexually intimate deepfakes produced by its Grok AI ‍chatbot violated its duty to protect people in the UK from content that could be illegal.
“There have been deeply concerning reports of the Grok AI chatbot account on X being used to create and share undressed images ⁠of people – which may amount to intimate image abuse or pornography – and sexualised images of children that may amount to...

items.translated_title: Surging memory-chip prices force Chinese smartphone maker Meizu to abandon launch

images.alt: People try out Meizu smartphones during the Mobile World Congress in Shanghai in June 2023. Photo: VCG/VCG via Getty Images
images.title: People try out Meizu smartphones during the Mobile World Congress in Shanghai in June 2023. Photo: VCG/VCG via Getty Images

items.content:
The global memory-chip crunch has forced a mainland Chinese smartphone manufacturer to pull the plug on the launch of a new handset, making it one of the first cancellations affecting the wider industry due to surging prices of the key component.
DreamSmart Group said that its Meizu smartphone brand had cancelled the release of Meizu 22 Air, a slim handset similar to Apple’s iPhone Air.
“The sharp rise in memory prices since the fourth quarter has not only impacted [production] costs, but also...

items.title: Ant International teams up with Google on use of Universal Commerce Protocol

items.translated_title: Ant International teams up with Google on use of Universal Commerce Protocol
items.content:
Ant International, the Singapore-based spin-off of Chinese fintech giant Ant Group, has teamed up with Google on standards for artificial intelligence agents that complete online shopping tasks for users, as AI continues to transform the e-commerce sector.
Ant International said in a statement on Monday it would endorse the US search and AI giant’s Universal Commerce Protocol (UCP), an open standard that powers agentic commerce.
“By leveraging our leading payment capabilities, Ant International...

items.translated_title: Alibaba’s Qwen family hits 700 million downloads to lead global open-source AI adoption
items.content:
Alibaba Cloud’s flagship Qwen family of artificial intelligence models surpassed 700 million downloads as of January on the developer platform Hugging Face, which made it the world’s most widely used open-source AI system.
According to research published by Interconnects.ai, citing data from Hugging Face, estimated Qwen downloads as of December alone exceeded the combined total of the next eight most popular models on the platform globally, including those from Meta Platforms and OpenAI, as well...

items.title: Hong Kong stocks edge higher on tech and pharmaceutical gains (原标题: Hong Kong stocks edge higher on tech gains and stabilising China inflation data)

items.translated_title: Hong Kong stocks edge higher on tech and pharmaceutical gains
items.content:
Hong Kong stocks rallied on Monday, lifted by gains in healthcare and technology shares, while daily turnover on mainland China’s exchanges surged to a record high.
The Hang Seng Index climbed 1.4 per cent to close at 26,608.48, while the Hang Seng Tech Index climbed 2.9 per cent. On the mainland, the CSI 300 Index advanced 0.65 per cent and the Shanghai Composite Index gained 1.1 per cent.
Trading volume on the Shanghai and Shenzhen exchanges shares hit a record 3.58 trillion yuan (US$513.2...

items.translated_title: China AI has ‘less than 20%’ chance to exceed US over next 3 to 5 years: Alibaba scientist

images.alt: China’s less than 20 per cent chance of exceeding the US is already a “highly optimistic” estimate, according to Alibaba’s Qwen team. Photo: Shutterstock
images.title: China’s less than 20 per cent chance of exceeding the US is already a “highly optimistic” estimate, according to Alibaba’s Qwen team. Photo: Shutterstock

items.content:
China’s artificial intelligence efforts are unlikely to catch up with the United States in the near term despite making significant headway in recent years, according to the country’s leading AI researchers.
The comments at a major industry conference in Beijing on Saturday underscored the gap between the two countries in semiconductor chips and chipmaking equipment, key resources for building out the infrastructure needed for developing cutting-edge AI models.
Lin Junyang, technical lead of...

items.title: How Hong Kong’s AI IPO surge supports China’s economic strategy
items.creator: Kun Tian
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: How Hong Kong’s AI IPO surge supports China’s economic strategy
items.content:
Hong Kong has started 2026 with a wave of IPOs driven by artificial intelligence (AI), led by the recent listing of Chinese chipmaker Biren Technology. Beyond the revival of market activity, the surge points to a clearer strategic direction.
China is increasingly using Hong Kong as an offshore capital platform for funding priority technologies – at a time when geopolitics is reshaping where innovation can be financed and how international capital can be accessed. This repositioning aligns...

items.title: Nvidia, Tesla chase same self-driving goal via different paths
items.creator: Bloomberg
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Nvidia, Tesla chase same self-driving goal via different paths

images.alt: Tesla CEO Elon Musk says that while getting an autonomous driving system to work most of the time was relatively easy, solving rare and unpredictable edge cases was far harder. Photo: Getty Images/TNS
images.title: Tesla CEO Elon Musk says that while getting an autonomous driving system to work most of the time was relatively easy, solving rare and unpredictable edge cases was far harder. Photo: Getty Images/TNS

items.content:
Jensen Huang took the stage at the CES trade show in Las Vegas this week to make the clearest pitch yet for Nvidia’s autonomous driving technology. In doing so, the CEO’s vision for vehicles that can drive themselves edged into the terrain of major customers like Tesla and its boss, Elon Musk.
Huang’s remarks sparked a widely watched – if notably polite – indirect multiday exchange between two of the most influential figures in technology. It also sharpened a central question about autonomous...

items.title: Elon Musk to open source X algorithm in 7 days amid global scrutiny
items.creator: Bloomberg
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Elon Musk to open source X algorithm in 7 days amid global scrutiny

images.alt: Elon Musk is the founder of xAI, which has developed the Grok chatbot. Photo: AFP
images.title: Elon Musk is the founder of xAI, which has developed the Grok chatbot. Photo: AFP

items.content:
Social media platform X will open its new algorithm to the public in seven days, Elon Musk said on Saturday, including the code used to decide what posts and advertisements are recommended to users.
“This will be repeated every 4 weeks, with comprehensive developer notes, to help you understand what changed,” Musk, who owns X, said in a post on the platform.
The billionaire did not say why X was making its algorithm open source. He and the company have clashed several times with regulators over...

items.title: How the AI race could play out for the US, China and the world
items.creator: Mark Purdy
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: How the AI race could play out for the US, China and the world
items.content:
The global artificial intelligence (AI) race remains one of the most hotly contested spheres of international competition. Few would bet today on an eventual winner, but current trends point to three possible scenarios that we should consider.
In the first scenario, the AI world is dominated by the US and China. While the US still has the technological edge, China is closing in fast and vies with the US for leadership on many of the key dimensions of AI prowess.
According to Stanford...
